oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Faculty of Main Street School, Nashville, Tennessee, 1892
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A group photo of the faculty of Main Street School located in Nashville, Tennessee. The Annual Report of the Superintendent lists the names and positions of teachers at Main Street School for session 1891-92: Mr. M. M. Ross, Principal; Mr. George D. Clements, Eighth Grade; Miss Jennie H. Frensley, Seventh Grade; Miss Ada Butler, Sixth and seventh grades; Miss Josie Schott, Sixth Grade; Miss Naomi Shea; Fifth grade; Miss Ella R. Walsh, Fifth Grade; Miss Maggie Handly, Fourth and fifth grades; Miss Zadie I. Geiger, Fourth Grade; Miss Hattie R. Cotton, Principal second floor; Miss Mary E. Pope, Fourth Grade; Miss Maggie Gallagher, Third Grade; Miss Emma E. Moulton, Third Grade; Miss Bessie Sutherland, First and third grades (organist); Miss Mary Matthews, First and second grades; and Miss Lena Wilson, First and second grades. Educators specifically identified by name in this photo are: Principal M. M. Ross (seated center) and George Demetrius Clements (standing on the extreme right). Main Street School was erected by the corporation of Edgefield at Seventh and Main circa 1870, and it became a city school when Edgefield was annexed to Nashville. It was used until 1894, when the original Warner school was erected and the Main Street School building was razed. Forms part of George Paul Clements, Jr. Collection. 1 photographic copy print.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Clements family; Clements, George D., 1843-1930; Ross, M. M.
